title: New: FTSE – Tidal Wave (ft Saint Saviour)
body:
_“Why’s everyone here so fucking happy?”_

Slow down a minute.

That can’t be right.

It took me at least four listens to get round to the sentiment of _Tidal Wave_, latest cut from [UK beatsmith](http://f-t-s-e.tumblr.com/ "Mumblr.") **FTSE**, because all its weapons-grade sadness (and make no mistake, sadness it is, misery of the highest fucking calibre) is dressed up in the kind of groove and slinking glimmer that was only hinted at on the downcast bedroom sketches of [his debut](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/19450-introducing-ftse/ "Self-promotion is sexy.") _**BEGIN**_. There’s the glowing Rhodes that opens the song, the attention to drum sound, the man himself prefacing his gloomy, beaten tirade with a cheeky little stab at melisma. It’s a tactic he then reappropriates on keys for a banging middle eight, like someone’s trapped a choir of furies in a jam jar. There’s the surprise brass swells, and [Saint Saviour](http://saintsaviour.co.uk/ "She's not named after Jesus. ")‘s star turns in the second verse and chorus (move over, ’cause she’s stealin’ the moment). _Tidal Wave_ smashes right into that maddening middle ground between hunger and restraint, and it’s gonna bust open whatever self-perpetuating pressure cabin you’ve trapped yourself in.

The _**FTSE I**_  EP, from which _Tidal Wave_ is lifted, is out July 1st on [Lucky Number](http://www.luckynumbermusic.com/ "Look, there's his neck again. ").
